conclusion: Determine the heat Q exchanged using the first law of thermodynamics.
Process from A to B is isobaric; process from B to C is isochoric.
Temperature at state A is 200 K; change in internal energy from A to C is 200 J.
Work done in isobaric process A to B is calculated using W_AB = P ΔV.
Pressure is constant at 3 x 10^5 Pa; volume changes from 1 x 10^-3 m^3 to 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Volume change ΔV is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
No work done in isochoric process B to C, W_BC = 0.
Total work done W_total from A to C is 900 J.
Apply first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Calculate heat Q: Q = ΔU + W_total.
